lead: Robotics is gaining significant traction in Europe as funding increases for deep tech startups, including those focused on innovative robotic technologies.

stories.title: Kembara closes €750M first close to fuel growth of European deep tech startups
stories.summary: Kembara Fund I has successfully closed its first fundraising round, amassing €750 million to support European deep tech startups, including those in the robotics sector. Managed by Mundi Ventures, the fund aims to reach a total of €1 billion, with significant backing from the European Investment Fund. This initiative is part of a broader effort to enhance local growth capital in Europe, particularly in cutting-edge fields like robotics.
